website_summaries.verdict: Costs more than some other rangefinders, but it offers numerous top-of-the-line features to help your game.
pros: Slope tech adjusts distance measurements to account for terrain changes
Vibrating burst lets you know when you've locked the target
Accurate settings to plus/minus 1 yard of target
cons: Sometimes struggles to zero in on the flag when trees are nearby

customer_reviews.title: Really good product. The vibration in hitting the target is ...
customer_reviews.text: Really good product. The vibration in hitting the target is great. Can get some other objects in the background like trees and get a wrong distance. But I've found that on any rangefinder. Not a real problem as most individuals using a product like this usually have a good idea of the proximate distance they are facing and if the reading passes the reasonableness test. I really like this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Browns guy

customer_reviews.title: Asian package
customer_reviews.text: I thought this was the “switch” version. It wasn’t. Still a very good range finder, it’s just not one you could use in serious tournament play. I still like the rangefinder. I did get the “Asian pack” and I’m not real sure what the difference is, other than a sticker that said “Asian pack” on it. So, if you are gonna buy this rangefinder definitely buy the Asian pack. I’ve never had a rangefinder before, so this may be normal, but I played in fog for the first time. It wasn’t bad and it just would not pick uo the flag, even around 100 yards out. Overall it is a good rangefinder
customer_reviews.author: Ronnie W.

customer_reviews.title: Best decision ever
customer_reviews.text: This product is amazing. I have been able to be more accurate with my shots. I got the one in Asian packaging, it did not have a slope on and off switch, slope is always on but i need it! Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Philip Bermel

customer_reviews.title: Have to have one
customer_reviews.text: It's so nice to have the rangefinder when you're golfing. It's easy to use so it's way faster than looking for yardage markers, etc. I just wish they had a safety feature like a passcode so if you lose it, it's no good for anyone else so the odds of them returning it to the clubhouse increases.
customer_reviews.author: DN

customer_reviews.title: Love this range finder
customer_reviews.text: I have had this range finder for long enough to write a review. I have had 0 issues with it and it delivers a solid yardage with slope accounted for. If it could only account for wind I might break 90 a bit more consistently. It does what you expect it to. I know this was a China version that saved me around $100 and at 1st I was apprehensive. don't be. Save some money and go ahead and make the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Nahm

customer_reviews.title: Great sometimes...
customer_reviews.text: Works ok, but does not provide a "jolt" when reading all flags...not sure why. It is erratic from course to course...possibly flags are laying limp or no reflectors on tops of some flags. When on the "right" course or right conditions it works great.
customer_reviews.author: TD Golfer

customer_reviews.title: Great Rangefinder
customer_reviews.text: Excellent range finder, the slope functions works really well and overall it feels like I’m getting distance accuracy within +/- 1 yard.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Centanni

customer_reviews.title: Game Changer!
customer_reviews.text: Works perfect! Doesn’t seem to be any difference in the device vs the packaging. The slope feature is a game changer.
customer_reviews.author: Irunandride

customer_reviews.title: Black spots on inside of lens.
customer_reviews.text: The unit must be a second. It has black spots inside of the lens. I haven't used it yet because of the winter weather in the northeast. Will further update if it doesn't work on the range.
customer_reviews.author: djhhauler

customer_reviews.title: Different package - same great product
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my husband for Christmas and he is in love!! This is listed as the "Asian" packaging; however, we did not notice any difference. It is the same product and has all of the instructions in English as well. Definitely worth purchasing the "Asian" packaging to save a few dollars.
customer_reviews.author: Brittany Poling

customer_reviews.title: Buy the best
customer_reviews.text: As usual Bushnell does it right....easy to use and hold...just something to think about, unless you play on really hilly or elevated courses forget the slope unless you get a good price....
customer_reviews.author: FT

customer_reviews.title: Worked well for 5 months...then done
customer_reviews.text: 5 months after I bought this the battery enclosure will not close. It seems that the body swelled up so the screw on battery enclosure doesn’t fit. No way for me to get in touch with the manufacturer.
customer_reviews.author: Peter

customer_reviews.title: Not accurate
customer_reviews.text: I had to return it because the readings were 10 yards off
customer_reviews.author: MicroDude

customer_reviews.title: Golf range finder
customer_reviews.text: Works very well. A good compliment to my golf game
customer_reviews.author: Michael Hardy

customer_reviews.title: Boyfriend LOVES the Bushnell Golf Tour V4!!
customer_reviews.text: This was a xmas gift for my boyfriend and he loves it.
customer_reviews.author: payrl39

customer_reviews.title: Got this for a gift for my husband. I ...
customer_reviews.text: Got this for a gift for my husband. I had a friend who is a pro golfer help me pick it out. He says this is one of the best
customer_reviews.author: lyndsay bailey

customer_reviews.title: written sizes are wrong, not such small
customer_reviews.text: This rangefinder is perfect, but the written dimensions are entirely incorrect, it is now in my hands, it should be 4" x 1-3/8" x 2-3/4", it is still very small
customer_reviews.author: S. Thomas

customer_reviews.title: V4 Slope
customer_reviews.text: Unlike my older model, this works much faster and accurate. Easy to catch the pin even with shaky hands.
customer_reviews.author: Desmond Heng

customer_reviews.title: and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: It is quick, concise, and easy to use. Love it!
customer_reviews.author: Randy Hall

customer_reviews.title: Nice
customer_reviews.text: Nice range finder. I really have to focus to settle it to find the target, but very accurate
customer_reviews.author: A. Kaelin

customer_reviews.title: Asian packaging no big deal
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the unit that was in the Asian packaging as it was much cheaper. Kind of a no brainer as far as I am concerned. Packing box was in english as well as a few other languages. The manual was also in english as well as a few other languages. Have no idea why the Asian packaging was $80 less in price, but glad I was not a fool to pay for the American packaging. Nice rangefinder, what you would expect from Bushnell. Having the slope displayed is a nice feature for my golf game.
customer_reviews.author: Jean R.

customer_reviews.title: It is very easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what I wanted!! It is very easy to use, and let me know the exact distance.
customer_reviews.author: HwiDong Jung

customer_reviews.title: good
customer_reviews.text: easy to use. But difficult to focus for more than 200yrds
customer_reviews.author: HONG Eunkee

customer_reviews.title: Great rangefinder
customer_reviews.text: I moved up from the V2 model which I loved. The V4 is lighter, faster, clearer and just as easy to use. I love this device.
customer_reviews.author: kenniget

customer_reviews.title: Very quick reading
customer_reviews.text: I lost my leupod rangefinder and bought this as a replacement. I am very happy with the performance. Quick and accurate reading, compact size makes it easy to fit in the cart's cup holder. It's an attractive looking scope and the bright color makes it stand out more so less chance for you to misplace it.
customer_reviews.author: Son Pham

customer_reviews.title: No updates needed! Can be used on any golf course!
customer_reviews.text: I used my range finder on the course and it gives you exact distance every time! My brother in law told me he didn't need to use it because he had the Bushnelll watch. But as it turns out the watch didn't have the golf course listed in his watch because the course was new - only 2 years old. So he had to depend on my range finder after all.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very un happy at the moment
customer_reviews.text: So far, brand new out of the box, and it didn't work. My son gave to his dad today, on Father's Day, before their round of golf, and not able to use it. We plan to try another battery, even though package says, change every 12 months... Very un happy at the moment, if new battery doesn't fix the issue, it will be returned ASAP!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Damaged and dirty.
customer_reviews.text: I bought it as "New" however, when I unboxed it, I immediately saw the red rim damaged. It seems that this bushnell was taken off the display after sitting ther for a while.
customer_reviews.author: carlos cerda

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Only used this product once but I love the slope feature.
customer_reviews.author: JORVILE

customer_reviews.title: great item to have on the course
customer_reviews.text: It's a lighter version of the V3, great item to have on the course.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Happy with the purchase
customer_reviews.text: This is my first rangefinder... It is easy to use and lightweight. I am excited to test it out on some courses with some large elevation changes.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Tucker

customer_reviews.title: Should have gotten sooner.
customer_reviews.text: Great tool, no more guessing on distance to elevated genes
customer_reviews.author: john winn

customer_reviews.title: Jolt or no Jolt
customer_reviews.text: Not impressed considering the price. Noit sure it is my particular unit or it's a general issue with the units. My unit vibrates (JOLTS) even when it does not pick up the flag. As a results while shooting at the green, it could jolt and give me say 150y. If I press the button to double check, I could get a reading of 200 y and still with a jolt.
customer_reviews.author: Wellington Mubatanhema

customer_reviews.title: Very good, I would recommend it to anyone who is ...
customer_reviews.text: Very good, I would recommend it to anyone who is loves the game of golf easy to use, accurate readings, golf is so much more fun
customer_reviews.author: Shaun

product_meta.title: Bushnell Golf Tour V4 Slope Laser Rangefinder
product_meta.description: The Tour V4 slope gives you Bushnell's patented, Tour trusted slope technology, that provides compensated distance based on hole's incline/decline. This unit is now legal for tournament play when slope mode is disabled. The Tour V4 slope packs an unbelievable feature set into a smaller, more ergonomically sound form factor.
feature_bullets: Pin seeker with jolt Technology provides you with short Vibrating bursts to reinforce the laser has laced onto the flag
Patented slope Technology provides compensated distance based on the incline or decline of the hole
Accurately ranges from 5 to 1,000 yards and 400+ yards to a flag within one yard
5x magnification and a fast focus System let's you see your shot clearly
Premium carry case, battery and 2-year limited Warranty are included
Class 1 laser with <0.5mW average power output

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
